title: Commending the Vernon Verona Sherrill Senior High School FFA Chapter on its designation as the NYS Agricultural Society's NYS FFA Chapter of the Year
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION commending the Vernon Verona Sherrill Senior High
School  FFA Chapter upon the occasion of its designation by the New York
State Agricultural Society as the New York State FFA Chapter of the Year
on January 6, 2011

WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  to  recognize  and
commend  young people who, by achieving success in an educational compe-
tition, inspire and bring  pride  to  themselves,  their  school,  their
community, and the great State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Such educational competitions and student organizations with-
in  our  schools help prepare our youth for their futures and are worthy
of praise and support; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern and in full accord with  its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor the
FFA Chapter of Vernon Verona Sherrill  Senior  High  School  (VVS  FFA),
Verona,  New  York, upon the occasion of its designation by the New York
State Agricultural Society as the New York State FFA Chapter of the Year
at the society's 179th Annual Agricultural Forum, held  in  Syracuse  on
January 6, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, The New York State Agricultural Society was organized in 1832
to  foster,  promote,  and improve New York State's food and agriculture
industry; the society's mission is to improve the condition of  agricul-
ture through education, leadership development and recognition programs,
such  as  the Chapter of the Year Award, which is proudly sponsored each
year by the New York State Grange; and
  WHEREAS, The VVS FFA chapter is student-led; its members are part of a
total VVS High School agricultural education program which opens a world
of opportunities to its  students,  connects  them  to  careers  in  the
science, business, and technology of agriculture, and provides them with
leadership, academic, and career experiences essential for success; and
  WHEREAS, While every agriculture education program in New York focuses
on  local  agriculture,  each is unique; VVS FFA's work with maple syrup
production has garnered attention not only on the State  level,  but  on
the regional and national levels as well; and
  WHEREAS,  FFA  members  at  VVS  are  involved  in every aspect of the
production, marketing and support of the maple  syrup  industry  in  New
York  State;  they tap trees, run lines, harvest the sap in buckets, and
boil the sap into syrup; and
  WHEREAS, They then bottle and sell the syrup in a student managed  and
operated  store  and,  in addition, work with their teacher each year to
host multiple maple-related events; and
  WHEREAS, From running evaporators to assuring  product  quality,  from
hosting  conferences  for field experts to managing $80,000 in earnings,
VVS FFA members gain experience and learn real-world life skills; and
  WHEREAS, In addition to its maple syrup  industry  endeavors  VVS  FFA
undertook  a special Willow Project; partnering with the Cornell Univer-
sity Horticulture Program and Cooperative Extension to plant a renewable
crop of willow and manage the three-acre demonstration plot to study its
connections to bioenergy; and
  WHEREAS, VVS FFA prides itself on being an integral part of a member's
education; its members also participate in many other school,  community
and  other  activities  and  have helped make FFA a popular and powerful
tradition in their Oneida County community; and
  WHEREAS, In earning recognition as New York State Chapter of the Year,
VVS FFA, ably taught and advised by Keith Schiebel and assistant advisor
Mark Peavey, proudly continues the chapter's history  and  tradition  of
dedication and accomplishment; and

  WHEREAS,  Poised  eagerly  with enthusiasm and determined purpose, the
members of VVS FFA stand honorably, with just pride in their achievement
and in eager anticipation of future challenges, understanding and appre-
ciating the caring counsel and support provided by their teachers, advi-
sors and parents; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate the Vernon Verona Sherrill Senior High School  FFA  Chapter
and  its  members  upon the occasion of the chapter's designation by the
New York State Agricultural Society as the New York State FFA Chapter of
the Year on January 6, 2011, and to offer them best wishes for a  future
of purposeful success and well-being; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the Vernon Verona Sherrill Senior High School FFA Chapter.
